'Ah, [placeholder], it seems our journey through Mount Gundabad shall have more than its fair share of surprises!

'My expedition and I will see to repairing the damage left by the Iron Crown, and we shall set the echo-horns across this great cavern into alignment once more. The warding-runes may never again repel our foes, but when the Mountain-home is ours again and evermore, I hope we find we have no need for them!

'I am certain Prince Durin and the others shall have need of your aid in the Clovengap and beyond, but I thank you for all you have done here, my friend. Without your aid, the secrets of our ancestors may well have been forgotten!

'Baruk Khazâd! For Gundabad!'

'You need not fear my wrath, [placeholder]. Approach, and let us speak!

'Long ago, when the Shaper's work was finished, I was bidden to rest beneath Mount Gundabad. In time, I awoke as Thrástan; different in form, but alike in mind and spirit to walk among Durin's Folk. In my long years of solitude, the two diverged, but I am now restored.

'At long last, my vigil nears its end and a new Age is soon to dawn. But fear not, I shall ward the Stone of Awakening from all evil that would seek to master it until I am called back to the Uttermost West.

'Yet many trials lay ahead for you, little one. You feel the call of the West, do you not? And yet, your fate is unwritten... and your deeds unfinished.'

'Yet many trials lay ahead for you, little one. Though the Darkness has been banished, evil remains in the hearts of Men. Only through vigilance shall the beauty and goodness of Middle-earth persist!'

Talk to Hermáth Stormhammer at Abkân'aban

'In light of what has happened here at Abkân'aban, I shall soon have to speak to Prince Durin.

'That a servant of the First Crafter would reveal himself to us is too unbelievable a tale to send by any missive! Only my voice might lend it any credibility... and even so, the Prince may have to see with his own eyes!

'Let us not trouble our new benefactor, [placeholder]. Our gratitude is enough, I think, and there are greater matters in this world for one of such power to lend his aid.

'You should speak to the others here and see if they are ready to depart. When that is so, come speak to me again!'
Talk to Hermáth Stormhammer at Watchers' Roost

'I hardly know what to say, [placeholder]...'

Spall gazes up at the White Stone Forge where Tamindur now stands watch.

'I have seen more in one day than I dreamt of seeing in a lifetime.

'As for me, my survey will continue unhindered now that the Iron Crown have been driven out of Gloomingtarn. Who knows what other secrets lie hidden for us to discover? I, for one, relish the chance to find them!

'When Lord Stormhammer wishes to depart, I shall be prepared.'
Despite his stony gaze, Tamindur appears to be pleased at your approach

'What an adventure, [placeholder]!

'From the Lonely Mountain to Elderslade and now to the very heart of Mount Gundabad... I am grateful our paths crossed when they did. Perhaps I was a bit too eager to confront the Iron Crown, but it all worked out in the end, didn't it?'

Hersegg smirks and looks to Tamindur.

'A victory hard won... and secured with as near a miracle as I've ever seen! The First Crafter himself must watch over us here in Mount Gundabad!

'I will be ready to depart in just a moment, my friend. Why don't you go and see if Spall is ready to set out?'
You can't be certain, but Tamindur appears to smile at your gesture
After the revelation of Thrástan's true identity and the defeat of the Iron Crown at Abkân'aban, the Gabil'akkâ has won a lasting victory in their efforts to reclaim Mount Gundabad.

Spall can be found at Abkân'aban in Gloomingtarn.\n\nAfter repelling the Iron Crown from Abkân'aban and the revelation of Thrástan's true identity, your allies remain gathered at Abkân'aban. You should talk to Spall.

Tamindur can be found at Abkân'aban in Gloomingtarn.\n\nAfter returning to Abkân'aban, Thrástan revealed himself to be a servant of the First Crafter named Tamindur the Forge-servant. You should approach Tamindur.
Approach Tamindur at Abkân'aban

Talk to Tamindur

Talk to Spall at Abkân'aban

Hermáth Stormhammer can be found at Abkân'aban in Gloomingtarn.\n\nAfter gathering your allies and speaking with Tamindur, you are ready to depart for Watchers' Roost. You should talk to Hermáth Stormhammer.
Talk to Hersegg at Abkân'aban
Hermáth Stormhammer can be found at Watchers' Roost in Gloomingtarn.\n\nAfter departing from Abkân'aban, you have returned to Watchers' Roost. You should talk to Hermáth Stormhammer.

'Is everyone prepared to depart? Very good, [placeholder].

'Let us return to Watchers' Roost and, at last, we can set about undoing the damage the Iron Crown has done to Gloomingtarn!'

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: You will swiftly travel to Watchers' Roost after advancing this quest.</rgb>

A Hallowed Return

'You need not fear my wrath, [placeholder]. Approach, and let us speak!

'Long ago, when the Shaper's work was finished, I was bidden to rest beneath Mount Gundabad. In time, I awoke as Thrástan; different in form, but alike in mind and spirit to walk among Durin's Folk. In my long years of solitude, the two diverged, but I am now restored.
